result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark T Horstmeyer

records.addlTxt: Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark T Horstmeyer in court.  Attorney Matt Last in court for Mark T Horstmeyer.  Attorney Matthew Torbenson, appearing for Erin Michelle Karshen, in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for trial.
As Asst. District Attorney Karshen is unable to appear in court on today's date, Asst. District Atty. Torbenson suggests a further scheduling conference as he does not have access to Asst. D.A. Karshen's trial calendar.
Court orders case adjourned for further scheduling/status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mark T Horstmeyer in court.  Attorney Matt Last in court for Mark T Horstmeyer.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Statements to the Court by defense counsel.
Court orders case adjourned for further status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark T Horstmeyer in court with Attorney Matt Last.  Jessica Bellows, appearing for Erin Karshen, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel advises Court he has received some of the discovery but additional discovery is still outstanding.
Defense counsel requests further adjournment for scheduling.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Borowski.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Sanders, Br. 28.

Defendant Mark T Horstmeyer in court with Attorney Matt Last.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Oral No Contact Order. No internet use for social media.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Mark T Horstmeyer in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Mark T Horstmeyer in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark T Horstmeyer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 060101,
Payable Number: 1016590,

Amount: $20.00
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
